Understands the analytic needs of law enforcement and translates these needs into meaningful and actionable data visualizations.        Standardizes data collection by developing methods for database design and validation.        Extracts data from databases and data warehouses for reporting and to facilitate sharing between multiple data systems.        Performs Tableau dashboard development.        Performs data analysis, data validation, data mapping/design, by accessing multiple sources, specifically data residing in data warehouses.        Uses SQL, Excel VBA or Python tools to automate reports and data ingestion processes.        Reviews internal data processes and systems, and identifies opportunities for improvement.        Analyzes data and identifies data gaps and/or data integrity issues.        Develops and deploys Tableau applications.        Completes related projects as assigned. Certifications:        Tableau Desktop Specialist, Tableau Data Analyst or other Tableau certifications are desirable. Strong experience in developing and implementing Tableau design principles.        Strong experience in optimizing the Tableau user experience.        Intermediate proficiency in SQL Server preferred (e.g., ability to create stored procedures).        Working knowledge of MS SQL databases required.        Working knowledge of Python highly desirable.        Experience integrating complex SQL Server Reporting Services and Tableau applications.        High level of proficiency with Microsoft Office programs.        Skills:        Demonstrated "hands-on" experience as a Tableau designer and analyst.        Ability to design complex management reports and interactive dashboards with drill-down to detail and analysis pathways to supporting reports and datasets.        Ability to develop a strong understanding of BPD's business and operational requirements while working with departmental users and analysts to define specific process, workflow and/or other technical requirements.        Ability to leverage Tableau's advanced functionality (e.g., parameters, actions, tooltip modifications, etc.) to create analytical dashboards. Format query results/reports in various ways. Ability to partner across BPD IT to support agile project development and short cycle iterations to deliver continuous business value.        Excellent writing and oral communications skills.        Strong organizational and interpersonal skills.        Excellent time management and organizational skills with attention to details.        Strong relationship management and collaboration skills.

title: SQL Analyst
job_description: Job DescriptionWe’re looking for a motivated, self-starter to take part in the development activities of our custom software platform responsible for managing and analyzing data using the PostgreSQL database system working alongside our internal and with outsourced offshore engineering teams. This role involves designing, implementing, and optimizing SQL queries, as well as ensuring the integrity and security of the PostgreSQL databases. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and provide valuable insights through data analysis.You’ll have the opportunity to witness your ideas come to fruition quickly and observe the impact of your decisions firsthand. You’ll also be able to engage in meaningful conversations with passionate individuals, and build lasting relationships with your team. Working with a small and dynamic global team and a fast-paced business operation, no day will be the same. If you’re passionate about the intersection between automotive and technology, this position may be an excellent fit for you.Your ResponsibilitiesDatabase ManagementDesign, implement, and maintain PostgreSQL databases. Optimize and tune database performance for efficient query execution. SQL Query DevelopmentWrite and optimize complex SQL queries to extract, transform, and analyze data. Create and modify stored procedures, functions, and triggers. Data AnalysisPerform data analysis using PostgreSQL tools and features. Generate reports and visualizations based on data insights. Data IntegrationIntegrate data from various sources into PostgreSQL databases. Implement and manage ETL processes to move and transform data. Data ModelingDevelop and maintain data models specific to PostgreSQL databases. Collaborate with stakeholders to understand and implement data requirements. Troubleshooting and MaintenanceIdentify and resolve database issues and errors in a timely manner. Implement backup and recovery procedures for PostgreSQL databases. DocumentationDocument PostgreSQL database processes, procedures, and best practices. Maintain data dictionaries and metadata information. SecurityImplement and maintain security measures for PostgreSQL databases, including access controls and encryption. This role will be in-office and located at Armatus HQ in Hunt Valley, MD.Who You AreYou have a versatile set of skills, particularly in project coordination and understanding development lifecycle, quality assurance, and some understanding of the technical details of software development. You’re a highly motivated self-starter with the ability to work both independently and within a team context. You have strong communication and interpersonal skills, and are able to quickly build trust and relationships with team members. You have strong analytical skills, and take a data-informed approach to decision-making.QualificationsEducational BackgroundBachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Technology, or a related field. Technical SkillsProficiency in SQL with a focus on PostgreSQL. Experience in managing and optimizing PostgreSQL databases. Familiarity with PostgreSQL-specific features such as JSONB, hstore, and full-text search. Analytical SkillsStrong analytical and problem-solving skills. Ability to interpret and analyze complex data sets within a PostgreSQL environment. Communication SkillsEffective communication skills to convey technical information to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Collaborative mindset to work effectively in a team environment. Attention to DetailMeticulous attention to detail to ensure data accuracy and integrity. AdaptabilityAbility to adapt to changing business needs and priorities. ExperiencePrevious experience as a SQL Analyst with a focus on PostgreSQL or similar relational database systems. Other Useful Skills: Awareness of AWS, Angular, NodeJS, CI/CD, Generative AI.Company DescriptionArmatus Dealer Uplift is a rapidly growing company in the Retail Automotive vendor space, and by far the industry leader specializing in retail warranty reimbursement submissions. We work with over 6,500 dealerships in 50 states and have exclusive endorsements with 20 State Dealer Associations.We are dedicated to supporting new car automotive dealers in achieving best-in-class retail warranty uplift results and we strive continually to refine our fully outsourced solution to provide an engagement experience free of disruption to our clients and their staff. In short – our goal is to bring the inarguable best value proposition to the automotive marketplace.Armatus Dealer Uplift is a rapidly growing company in the Retail Automotive vendor space, and by far the industry leader specializing in retail warranty reimbursement submissions. We work with over 6,500 dealerships in 50 states and have exclusive endorsements with 20 State Dealer Associations. We are dedicated to supporting new car automotive dealers in achieving best-in-class retail warranty uplift results and we strive continually to refine our fully outsourced solution to provide an engagement experience free of disruption to our clients and their staff. In short – our goal is to bring the inarguable best value proposition to the automotive marketplace.

title: Senior Analyst, Pricing/Profit Improvement
job_description: TriMark USA is the country’s largest provider of design services, equipment, and supplies to the foodservice industry. We proudly serve our customers by providing design services, commercial equipment, and foodservice supplies across a wide range of industries and business sectors. Headquartered in Massachusetts, with a history dating back to 1896, we have locations across the country that offer foodservice operators an unparalleled level of service by combining our unique design capabilities and our expert market knowledge with the purchasing strength, delivery, installation, and after-sales service capabilities of a national company. Our employees are focused on creating customized solutions for our clients to ensure they achieve their culinary goals while upholding our I.C.A.R.E. values: Integrity , Customer Service , Accountability , Respect , and Excellence . For more information, please visit: www.trimarkusa.com Why you’ll love it here!  Benefits include Medical, Dental, Vision, Tuition Reimbursement, Pet, and Legal Insurance.Position Summary The Senior Pricing/Profit Improvement Analyst reports to the Senior Vice President, Pricing & Business Analytics.  Located in Mansfield, MA.  Full-Time  Hybrid As a Senior Pricing/Profit Improvement Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in driving the company's growth through meticulous analysis of category and customer profitability. You will bring expertise in financial analysis, pricing strategies, and project management to enhance overall profitability. This position requires a proactive and strategic approach to contribute to ongoing initiatives, collaborate with sales leadership, and assist in achieving annual incremental EBITDA targets.Essential Functions & Responsibilities  Profitability Data Development:  Lead the ongoing development of profitability data sets, ensuring accuracy and maintaining data quality standards.  Create comprehensive fact bases for divisions, identifying trends, opportunities, and hypotheses to optimize profitability.  Pricing and Financial Analysis:  Conduct thorough pricing analysis, financial assessments, and perform distribution and account deep-dives.  Drive category reviews and actively contribute to initiatives aimed at maximizing overall profitability.  Sales Leadership Support:  Collaborate with divisional sales leadership to track and implement actions identified through profitability initiatives.  Take accountability for achieving annual incremental EBITDA targets and identify continuous improvement opportunities.  Data Management and Reporting:  Manage data input and output effectively using business profitability tools.  Oversee reporting related to customer profitability and margin targets, providing insightful management reports and presentations.  Recommendations and Action Tracking:  Provide strategic recommendations and hypotheses on actions to improve profitability based on comprehensive reports.  Facilitate and manage the ongoing account review process, ensuring effective action tracking.  Data Integrity and Auditing:  Conduct regular audits on applications and processes to maintain data integrity.  Collaborate with IT liaisons to define data requirements for corporate-wide reporting systems.  Ad Hoc Projects:  Undertake ad hoc projects, analyses, and data extractions as assigned, showcasing adaptability and analytical prowess. Competencies Demonstrated expertise in financial analysis, pricing strategies, and project management.  Proactive problem-solving mindset with a bias for action.  Strong analytical skills and a deep understanding of corporate financial data.  Exceptional organizational and prioritization skills.  Effective written and verbal communication skills.  Proven ability to manage and prioritize tasks effectively. Qualifications & Experience 4 – 6 years of experience in a pricing, financial analysis, or related role, or equivalent military or practical experience.  Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel with advanced analytical capabilities.  Strong understanding of business profitability tools.  Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, and/or Alteryx.  Ability to successfully pass a background check post offer acceptance. The range provided represents the national average pay range for this position and is considered to be a general guideline. Pay for this position will reflect the candidate’s unique qualifications and may be higher or lower than the range provided based on employee geographic location. Additional factors considered in extending an offer include (but are not limited to) responsibilities of the job, education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity, alignment with market data, applicable bargaining agreement (if any), or other local, state, and federal law.In addition to base salary, this role will be eligible for participation in TriMark’s’ benefits programs, including medical, dental, vision, 401K (with employer match), etc. Leadership positions may also qualify for participation in bonus programs commensurate with role and scope of responsibility.TriMark’s commitment to diversity, inclusion and belonging is a purposeful mission of strengthening our organization and those we serve by uniting the unique and beautiful differences of our employees. This mission is instilled in the fiber of who we are as a company, setting the standard for our industry. We are committed to promoting diversity, inclusion and belonging through sharing, education, and experiences.TriMark USA provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.If you require reasonable accommodation in completing this application, interviewing, completing any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participating in the employee selection process, please direct your inquiries to accommodations@trimarkusa.com .Apply Now

title: Sr. Operation Analyst
job_description: ASR Group is the world’s largest refiner and marketer of cane sugar, with an annual production capacity of more than 6 million tons of sugar. The company produces a full line of grocery, industrial, food service and specialty sweetener products. Across North America, ASR Group owns and operates six sugar refineries, located in Louisiana, New York, California, Maryland, Canada and Mexico. In the European Union, the company owns and operates sugar refineries in England, Portugal. ASR Group also owns and operates mills in Mexico and Belize. The company’s brand portfolio includes the leading brands Domino®, C&H®, Redpath®, Tate & Lyle®, Lyle’s® and Sidul®.OverviewThe Sr Operations Analyst will drive operational excellence across ASR manufacturing operations – the single most important driver of ASR profitability. The Sr Operations Analyst will lead aimed at improving the efficiency and sustainability of ASR operations (e.g., sugar refining, packaging, maintenance, distribution) while supporting some of the business’s most critical decisions. Additionally, this role will establish, track, troubleshoot and present operational Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) to senior ASR leadership including the Global CFO and SVP Operations. The Sr Operations Analyst reports to the Director of Operational Finance.Detailed Roles & Responsibilities Use critical thinking and analysis to drive and lead change across all aspects of ASR’s business – particularly in operations, but also supply chain, sales, marketing and other functions as needed  Extract insights from data and effectively use images, charts, and conceptual frameworks to synthesize that data  Develop actionable recommendations  Create and deliver professional presentations to senior leadership  Collaborate with ASR colleagues across functions and regions in implementing solutions  Drive continuous process improvement within Finance and across all ASR processes  Support ASR’s annual budget process, to include detailed evaluation of all budget plans, budget compilation, and final presentation Work Experience 3-5 years of experience required of hands-on engineering operations experience including involving data analysis, model building, continuous improvement  Experience supporting and analyzing performance of manufacturing operations is a plus Education Requirements B.A. or B.S. required in Engineering (industrial, mechanical, chemical or civil)  M.B.A. or Master’s in Finance/Accounting-related field of study is a plus but not required Essential Capabilities (knowledge, Skills, Abilities And Personal Attributes) Data sleuth – approaches problems with an unbiased, objective, and data-first approach  A willingness to learn about our business, leaving your desk and spending time in a manufacturing environment  Comfortable in communicating with stakeholders at all levels of seniority  Highly analytical and with an ability to draw insight from large data sets  Strong knowledge of financial and accounting concepts required  Knowledge of manufacturing processes and cost accounting principles is a plus but not required  Strong Excel / Power BI / PowerPoint skills – beneficial  A willingness to learn – essential  Experience using SAP / Anaplan – beneficial  Organized and capable of prioritizing and managing multiple activities simultaneously  LOCATION OF ROLE  Baltimore, MD  Some travel is required (likely 5%-15% of time) IND123We are an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, creed, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other category protected under federal, state, or local law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.

title: Sr. Analyst Financial Planning and Analysis
job_description: Perdue Farms is a family-owned food and agriculture company now in its second century of growth and innovation. We were founded on trust—a value that carries through everything we do. Perdue Foods is a leader in Premium Proteins and Perdue AgriBusiness ranks among the top US grain companies.SummaryThe Senior Financial Analyst will deliver timely and accurate forecasts, budgets and analytics for the Financial Planning and Analysis (FP&A) department. These responsibilities include developing financial models, analyzing trends, collaborating with business partners, presenting insights to management, and performing ad hoc analyses upon request. The Senior Financial Analyst will report to the FP&A Director, and interact frequently with the VP of FP&A, the SVP of Whole Bird Analytics and Profit, and other executives throughout the company.Principal And Essential Duties & ResponsibilitiesCollaborates with the Director of FP&A of the Whole Bird Analytics team, SVP Whole Bird Analytics and Profit, and Sr Directors of Demand Planning in modeling Perdue business choices against Whole Bird Metrics and Key Process indicators to improve profit, optimize revenue, and capacity for commercial contracts and for the corporation at weekly, monthly, quarterly, and annual reporting levelsUtilize data visualization best practices to present complex information in a clear and concise manner; create and maintain interactive and visually-appealing dashboards that use tools such as PowerBI. Deliver timely and accurate forecasts and budgets. Present trend analyses, manage changes and resolve issues. Provide transparency to methodology and confirm changes with business partners. Develop and optimize complex financial models that accurately capture financial trends by category. Analyze data, establish assumptions and conduct what-if scenarios. Identify risks and opportunities and provide recommendations. Independently design and execute complex ad hoc analyses as requested to answer questions regarding financial performance for multiple departments. Gather necessary data, summarize insights, create clear written communication documents to present findings. Drive standardization of finance activities and scalable routines, including development of training guides and work step instructions. Minimum Education And Experience RequirementsBachelor’s degree (preferably in an analytical field) with 5 years of experience within a financial planning and analysis group. Our ideal candidate will have/be:Working knowledge of financial and accounting principles. Display strong analytical aptitude, desire to deal with ambiguity, synthesize complex data and draw business insights. Ability to identify patterns from disparate sources and deliver comprehensive analyses. Strong communication and organizational skills, with the ability to work on multiple projects. A detail-oriented approach, must pay close attention to details and error check own work. Ability to work independently. Trustworthy with confidential information. Reliability (attendance and timeliness) important to ensure execution of deliverables. Experience PreferredCustomer service mindset and ability to work with internal “clients” around the company. Ability to cope with pressure and changing priorities with a focus on delivering results. Strong Microsoft Office skills as well as the ability to learn software applications (i.e. SAP, PowerBI, Hyperion Essbase). Proactively initiates changes to improve work processes. Experience in protein, consumer products or foods-related industries is a plus. Environmental Factors And Physical RequirementsPosition is mostly sedentary but may require occasional moving to other offices or buildings. May need to move light equipment or supplies from one place to another. May need to access files, supplies and equipment. Work activity is in an office, open-partitioned, cubicle environment. Perdue Farms, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.

title: Analyst, Financial Planning & Analysis
job_description: Position OverviewThe Analyst, FP&A will support and partner within the Finance, Operations, and Commercial function to forecast, analyze trends, create metrics and perform analysis to support strategic business decisions. The FP&A Analyst will be integral in building, reporting and overseeing the financial planning process. This person will have a comprehensive understanding of all key business drivers and financial models that enable the team to deliver insightful, value-added analysis across the company. This role is part of the FP&A team and is part of a small team that has a large and growing role in the organization working with senior leadership to drive continuous improvement and achieve the Company’s aggressive growth targets.Key Job ResponsibilitiesBudgeting, Forecasting and Planning Assist in long range business evaluation process including worldwide forecasts, scenario/investment planning and presentations/discussions with key external stakeholders. Partner with planning and analysis in the development of the Company’s emerging Digital business unit as the event industry evolves from the pandemic impact. Facilitate the budgeting process and subsequent forecasts.Financial Analysis Analyze and extract insights from highly complex data sets and communicate insights in simple, executive level written form. Support significant ad hoc opportunities for leadership in both domestic business units and international. Execute ad-hoc financial/quantitative analysis and various reporting requests in support of business unit and corporate managers.Finance/Operations Collaboration Participate in monthly business reviews and provide analytical support (focused on strategic insights) to the operational and commercial leadership teams. Identify and implement financially and operationally relevant Key Performance Indicators across and within respective business units. Drive improvements in reporting, analytics and dashboards to support business leadership decision making. Leverage data to drive strategic insights and make actionable, results oriented recommendations to drive business value.Job Requirements BA/BS degree in finance, accounting, business, economics, or related field. 2+ years of FP&A experience or 3+ years of relevant work experience in a finance environment (including Investment Banking, Private Equity, Corporate Finance and consulting, as needed). Strong financial acumen including experience with forecasting, budgeting, and variance analysis. Superior written and verbal communication skills. Detail-oriented and data-driven. Ability to balance multiple, diverse priorities and produce high quality deliverables. Functional knowledge of financial reporting systems and methodologies. title: Senior Analyst - Investments
job_description: Who We AreJBG SMITH owns, operates, invests in, and develops mixed-use properties in high-growth and high barrier-to-entry submarkets in and around Washington, DC, most notably National Landing. Approximately 75.0% of JBG SMITH's holdings are in the National Landing submarket in Northern Virginia, which is anchored by four key demand drivers: Amazon's new headquarters  Virginia Tech's Innovation Campus  The Pentagon  JBG SMITH’s 5G digital infrastructure JBG SMITH's dynamic portfolio currently comprises 14.2 million square feet of high-growth office, multifamily, and retail assets at share, 99% of which are Metro-served. It also maintains a development pipeline encompassing 8.8 million square feet of mixed-use, primarily multifamily, development opportunities.LEO Impact Capital is JBG SMITH’s dedicated affordable workforce housing, investment, operations, and financing platform. LEO acquires, operates, and finances multifamily housing in high-impact neighborhoods utilizing a set of Impact Principles designed to preserve affordability for middle-income residents – such as teachers, healthcare workers, first responders, administrative professionals, and other workers whose services are vital to thriving communities— produce competitive returns for investors, reduce risks, and make buildings more sustainable. The platform’s portfolio consists of over 3,000 units with an active acquisition pipeline across multiple markets. LEO’s work is supported by the deep capacity and extensive real estate expertise of the broader JBG SMITH organization.Position SummaryJBG SMITH is seeking financial analyst candidates to support its investments and workforce housing (LEO Impact Capital) teams. The role will work on a wide range of projects and assignments. Responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:What You'll DoFinancial Modeling: Create and maintain valuation models for new investment pursuits, new development projects, and existing assets in the portfolio.Transactions: Coordinate with internal and external team members to assist in the pipeline tracking, due diligence, and closing processes for acquisitions and disposition processes.Research: Synthesize internal and external data related to demographics, rent, operating expenses, and capital expenditures. sBusiness Plans: Assist with the development of the initial business plans for new and existing investments. Presentations: Prepare memoranda and presentations related to market updates, scenario analyses, investment opportunities, and reporting for lenders, partners, and Senior Executives.Operations: Review and analyze business plans, loan documents, leasing activity, and monthly property operating performance.What You'll Need To Succeed (requirements)Experience: 3 - 5 years of experience with superior quantitative skills and analytical abilities (investment banking, real estate finance, private equity, or brokerage preferred)Academic: Bachelor’s degree required, preferably in real estate, finance or business administrationSkills: Attention to detail, proficiency in financial modeling in Microsoft Excel, superior written and verbal communication skills, advanced technical skills and ability to analyze complex datasets, and ability to prepare PowerPoint presentationsJBG SMITH is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer, making decisions without discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, genetic information or any other protected class, in accordance with applicable law.

title: Business Process Engineer with Security Clearance
job_description: 08th April, 2024 Role: Business Process Engineer/ Analyst (Customer-Facing Applications).Location: Hybrid / Suitland, MD.Job Description: Seeking qualified candidates to assist in the modernization of the Automated Maritime System (AMS) that produces authoritative data products used throughout the Defense and Intelligence Communities. We provide Solution Architecture and Product Management services in the form of modernization architecture, requirements, customer-centric processes, technology, and people integration (user experience), plans development, and reinforcing customer engagement. The focus of this effort is to facilitate AMS becoming cloud native, data-centric, aligned, and effective in supporting users as they deliver their naval fleet and intelligence mission objectives. Job Description: Looking for a talented and motivated Business Process Engineer with modernization experience in both on-premise and cloud environments who is passionate about optimizing technology to better support the users delivering the Intelligence mission. This individual will work as part of a product management team guiding the agile software development team to translate operational needs into technical and data specifications, that are then transformed into a refactored cloud-native, data-centric, AMS. The objective is to provide maritime and intelligence mission users the Marine Domain Awareness information and reporting seamlessly to meet mission objectives. A successful applicant will be someone who has the experience and knowledge to capture user and operational requirements, drive that into data-centric requirements and streamlined user experiences, and develop and guide the plan for realized modernization. You will be responsible for determining the application requirements needed to enhance the experience of our customers. You will act as a liaison between functional/technical stakeholders and you will lead the analysis and planning to enable AMS customer-facing applications and processes to be improved to meet current and future intelligence needs. * Usher feature development from inception through release as well as provide production support. This includes creating project charters, drafting and socializing story maps, detailing technical specifications, refining UI/UX requirements, and crafting application roll-out strategies to ensure seamless releases. * Be able to operate across multiple projects simultaneously and perform a variety of tasks, from addressing product modernization to soliciting functional requirements from business stakeholders. * Proactively identify and solve conflicting requirements across teams. Be able to answer questions, provide details, address changes to requirements, and facilitate dialog across teams. * Independently perform functional analysis for new modernization requirements, as well as document functional and system requirements and solution designs. * Facilitate meetings, manage and guide conversations with differing opinions, and communicate clearly and effectively with a variety of audiences. * Be a key contributor to the software development lifecycle, including ensuring that project deliverables meet or exceed ONI's policies, procedures, and standards. Qualifications: * Extensive experience with business analysis (5+ years). * Demonstrated success leading development teams within an agile framework, with experience tracking and removing impediments. * Experience with working in a fast-paced software development environment leveraging continuous delivery, infrastructure as code, and automated testing. * Exceptional written and oral communication skills sufficient to communicate effectively with nontechnical and technical business clients and teams. * Ability to independently define requirements, acceptance criteria, and functional designs for secure, data-centric systems. * Experience working with user flows, functional wireframes, storyboards, mockups, prototypes, user personas, scenarios, and other UX deliverables. * Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills. * Experience working in a production support environment, particularly one with rapid response requirements. * Experience working/engaging with the naval fleet and/or Maritime Intelligence Environment. * Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, finance, or business, or equivalent experience in software production or programming. * TS/SCI Clearance required. * DoD IAT Level II Certification (per DoD 8570.01). Nice If You Haves: * Relevant certification for process engineering * Experience with Agile, SCRUM project management methodology * Experience working with Data APIs preferred * Experience working with AWS technologies preferred * Strong oral and written communication skills COVID-19 Vaccination Requirements: As a federal contractor, we are subject to any federal vaccine mandates or other customer/facility vaccination requirements. As such, to protect the health and safety of its employees and to comply with customer requirements, we may require employees in certain positions to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Vaccination requirements will depend on the status of the federal contractor mandate and customer site requirements. Apply For Job

title: Budget Analyst
job_description: Requisition ID: 5818Location:Greenbelt, MD, US, 20770Pay Type: SalaryARE YOU READY TO BUILD PROGRESS WITH US? Driven by our purpose: Building progress for people and the planet. We are transforming to become the global leader in innovative and sustainable building solutions. Holcim is enabling greener cities, smarter infrastructure and improving living standards around the world. With sustainability at the core of its strategy Holcim is becoming a net zero company, with its people and communities at the heart of its success. The company is driving circular construction as a world leader in recycling to build more with less. Holcim is 70,000 people around the world who are passionate about building progress for people and the planet through four business segments: Cement, Ready-Mix Concrete, Aggregates and Solutions & Products.DescriptionJOB DESCRIPTION:Job DutiesHolcim (US) Inc. seeks a Budget Analyst at our office in Greenbelt, MD to support the Operation and Finance team and be a key member of the Asphalt team. The Budget Analyst’s job duties will include:Supporting the management of the department’s business and accounting systems, policies, and processes within Holcim procedures and financial policies.Ensuring that all financial transactions for the department are processed appropriately, under the supervision of the manager of finance and administration. Overseeing processes/issues contracts, purchase orders, vendor invoices; assigning appropriate cost codes; and ensuring work-flow processes flow smoothly. Monitoring the budget spending in whole and per area to ensure it is within budget limits and/or fiscal practices are followed. This includes allocations, expenditures, and related financial activities. Analyzing business information (e.g., labor and non-labor expenditures, utility expenses, inventory management, cost projections, etc.) to provide support, and recommendations to the operation team Preparing financial and budget tracking reports for each plant. Working within Facilities to re-engineer systems, processes, and procedures to improve financial reporting and streamline workflows. Supporting compliance with risk management, legal, financial requirements within established timeframes Demonstrating a commitment to communicating, improving, and adhering to safety policies in all work environments and areas. Note, this position does not require travel.RequirementsThe position of Budget Analyst requires a bachelor’s degree, or its foreign equivalent, in Accounting, Business Administration/Management, Supply Chain Management, or a closely-related field, plus 2 years of experience in the job offered, as a Management/Operations/Business Analyst, or in a related business analysis role. The position requires the following number of years of experience with each of the following: 2 years: Conducting financial analysis activities, including reading and creating financial statements (including Balance Sheets and P/L statements)  2 years: Conducting inventory management and supply chain management 2 years: SAP, Microsoft Office Applications, VLOOKUP, PivotTable, and VBA in Excel 1 year: Conducting purchase order management, overseeing product management processes, and overseeing implementation methods.  1 year: Conducting risk management and contract management 1 year: Working with plants/warehouses and retail/wholesale businesses 1 year: Applying supply-demand and production procedures.Your Holcim ExperienceAt Holcim, there is endless opportunity for you to play your part. Whether you’re in a technical, managerial, or frontline role, you can shape a career that works for you. With us you’ll have the chance to embrace the passion we share for our planet. You’ll be encouraged to seek out diverse perspectives, share your ideas and build the skills and connections you need to perform at your best. Because it’s only when we work together in a culture where everyone thrives, that we can build the world we all want to live in.Click To View Company Benefits OverviewIn compliance with the ADA Amendments Act (ADAAA), if you have a disability and would like to request accommodation in order to apply for a position with us, please call (773) 355-4557 or email recruiting-accommodations@holcim.com. This email address and phone number should only be used for accommodations and not general inquiries or resume submittals.Please visit our Pay Transparency Policy StatementDriven by our purpose to build sustainable solutions for people and our planet, Holcim US encourages interested candidates who meet many, even if not all of the job requirements to apply for a position. We provide a safe working environment for all and strive for diversity in our teams and inclusivity in our work.We take pride in our hiring processes and our commitment to all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, ethnicity, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, parental status, genetic information, citizenship, physical or mental disability, past, current, or prospective service in the uniformed services, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local law. Our goal is to drive diversity in our teams and inclusivity in our work. Holcim (US) Inc., Holcim - ACM Management, Inc., and their affiliates and subsidiaries are an Equal Opportunity Employer, deciding all employment on the basis of qualification, merit and business need.While we sincerely appreciate all applications, only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.Nearest Major Market: Washington DC

title: Data Scientist
job_description: Help Help DutiesWHAT IS THE HCO- HUMAN CAPITAL OFFICE DIVISION?A description of the business units can be found at: https://www.jobs.irs.gov/about/who/business-divisionsVacancies Will Be Filled In The Following Specialty AreasHuman Capital Strategy PlanningThe following are the duties of this position at the full working level .Collaborates with business and technology partners to understand business needs, identify opportunities, and develop and implement analytical solutions.Provide a robust data visualization platform to translate complex business needs, requirements and strategy, multiple data sets and other data points into conceptual, relevant, and straightforward visual tools, reports, and analytical solutions. The analyst uses extensive knowledge of business intelligence, plots, information graphics and quantitative data to design, prepare, test, validate and deploy compelling, insightful, and timely delivered data visualization tools.The incumbent will work closely with HCO Labor Relations personnel to execute studies, use of sensitive data, and provide executive briefings for labor relations, labor contracts, bargaining strategy, settlement agreements, business unit outreach, and special projects. The incumbent's analyses and recommendations have a direct impact on influencing human capital policies and practices, union negotiation and improving the overall utilization of HCO resources.Develop standard templates and data/information displays that communicate complete information in simple, insightful ways that accelerate decisions and improve accountability.Translate abstract information and connection points among a variety of data sets, enabling the creation of accurate, clear, concise and near real time cross-functional reporting for IRS and Human Capital leadership to gain and/or improve insights which drive strategic decision-making and formal business actions.This position has career progression. If you are selected at a grade level lower than the full working level, you may be non-competitively promoted as your career progresses. For example, you may be hired as a GS-05, but if the position has career progression to GS-11, then you may move from a GS-05 to a GS-11 in as little as three years.

title: Finance Analyst - East Coast Infrastructure
job_description: Requisition ID: 170346Job Level: Entry LevelHome District/Group: Eastern DistrictDepartment: Operational FinanceMarket: TransportationEmployment Type: Full TimePosition OverviewAre you interested in helping be responsible for the business management of projects ranging from $1 million to $4 billion? How about taking part in key forecasting and accounting practices? If this is something that interests you, Kiewit is looking for individuals who can make a profound impact on our company culture every day!The Finance Analyst is an entry level role focused on supporting a project in accounting and finance related functions. Each project at Kiewit is run like a small business, with the Finance Analyst concentrated on critical tasks such as cost control, payroll, accounts payable/receivable, human capital management, and compliance. This position will become skilled executing processes and utilizing tools related to different types of cost and revenue components such as labor, construction equipment, materials, and subcontracts. The Business Specialist will be an integral part of the month end close out process, and assist with preparing a financial reporting package for project management.At Kiewit, the scale of our operations is huge. Our construction and engineering projects span across the United States, Canada and Mexico, improving and connecting communities with every initiative. We depend on our high-performing operations support professionals — they’re the glue that holds multiple areas of the business together and the catalysts that make things happen. We hire only the most driven people and we offer them diverse career opportunities, strong leadership and mentorship, rewarding, collaborative work, and responsibility they won’t find just anywhere. We’re always pushing new limits. You can too.District OverviewKiewit’s infrastructure work on the East Coast specializes in challenging heavy civil construction projects all along the coast. We are leaders in bridge, transit, foundation, tunnel, and water/wastewater construction while specializing in cast-in-place concrete, structural steel erection, earthwork, pile driving, and caissons. A lot of the work focuses on the Transportation, Water/Wastewater and Power markets. With our experienced and dedicated employees, extensive resources and in-depth market knowledge, we can handle projects of any size. We are are looking for individuals who are passionate about infrastructure and committed to the construction industry as opposed to design. Because our people receive continuous and extensive training, hands-on experience, and challenging responsibilities from the day they join our team, they quickly develop the expertise that has earned our company its reputation as the premier contractor on the East Coast.LocationKiewit is a company that goes where the work is, which means a career with us can take you and your family to exciting parts of North America – and maybe even beyond. Our Infrastructure work on the east coast goes from the Great Lakes area, to upper New England, all the way down to the southern tip of Florida. Job assignment location will be determined closer to your start date. Must be able to travel and relocate as frequently as business needs require. These projects are happening in large cities and small towns, so you have a chance to experience it all!Responsibilities Recognizes the importance of being a team player by adapting to project needs and helping in other areas as needed Fosters relationships with the Operations team and shows a willingness to learn about the work Understands the payroll and HR process workflow, and masters the systems used to properly hire, transfer, terminate, and pay all employees Comprehends how goods are purchased, invoices are received and paid, and maintains purchasing workflow internal controls Demonstrates understanding of the accounts payable process workflow and is able troubleshoot payment or vendor issues Understands intercompany and client billing process workflow, importance of timely and accurate billing documentation, and the effects of timeliness on cash management Ensures that all cost and cost adjustments are reviewed for accuracy to meet company standards and accounting rules Reviews costs, quantity claiming, budget structure and exception reports and makes appropriate corrections to ensure accurate reporting for management Identifies, adjusts, and reviews forecast and budget issues with the cost report to confirm proper recognition of cost and revenue Displays first-rate customer service skills – maintains a positive attitude and always willing to offer a helping hand to other team members Maintains highly organized work environment, understands importance of time management, and communicates in a clear, concise and effective manner Follows the Corporate Compliance Program and works in conjunction with the compliance department to implement all EEO and labor laws at the project levelQualifications Ability to relocate in the Southeast region of the United States Ability to travel up to 25% 0-2 years' financial/data analysis experience Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics, Statistics, Business Management, or equivalent degree Minimum GPA of 3.0 or above Previous internship experience is preferred Working knowledge of Microsoft Excel, Word and Outlook Experience working with Pivot Tables, V-Look Ups, and other key excel functions is preferred Effective oral and written communication, organization and interpersonal skills. Strong attention to detail with the ability to recognize discrepancies Positive attitude, eagerness to learn, and passionate for continuous improvement Must be able to freely access all parts of a construction site in wide-ranging climates and environments Ability to work well independently, as well as part of a team. Must have a valid Driver’s LicenseOther common names for this role: Business Manager, Business Analyst, Financial AnalystOther Requirements: Regular, reliable attendance Work productively and meet deadlines timely Communicate and interact effectively and professionally with supervisors, employees, and others individually or in a team environment Perform work safely and effectively. Understand and follow oral and written instructions, including warning signs, equipment use, and other policies. Work during normal operating hours to organize and complete work within given deadlines. Work overtime and weekends as required. May work at various different locations and conditions may varyBase Compensation: $70,200 - $87,560(Actual compensation is subject to variation due to such factors as education, experience, skillset, and/or location)We offer our fulltime staff employees a comprehensive benefits package that’s among the best in our industry, including top-tier medical, dental and vision plans covering eligible employees and dependents, voluntary wellness and employee assistance programs, life insurance, disability, retirement plans with matching, and generous paid time off.We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

title: Senior Financial Analyst

Driving process improvement and policy development initiatives that impact the function. Coordinating with different teams to gather inputs and build consensus on financial estimates. ensure the accuracy of current SOPs and assist SBS Accounting Analyst and Global Staff Accountants to revise if neededMentor new SBS Accounting Analysts and Staff Accountants at SBS Global team on Sysco Accounting processes and cultureSuggest process improvements and works with upstream process owners to streamline the end-to-end processesSupport the Accounting Manager on overall team management where necessaryComplete special projects as necessaryEnsures adherence to department goals/metrics, Internal Audit reports, and SLAsComplete SBS Accounting Analyst responsibilities (as necessary and appropriate)EducationBachelor Degree in Accounting or Finance Experience5 years Accounting or related experienceSkillsDemonstrates the ability to analyze and reconcile reportsDemonstrates skills in problem solving, team building, total quality managementAbility to find & resolve discrepanciesAble to collaborate and work cross-functionally to solve problemsKnowledge of U.S. GAAPStrong knowledge of Microsoft Office suite, specialized accounting / finance software ERP Systems (i.e., Workday, Visual Produce, etc.) and data wrangling software (i.e., Alteryx)Strong communication skillsOverviewSysco is the global leader in foodservice distribution. title: Pricing Analyst I - HYBRID
job_description: Seeking highly motivated individuals looking for an exciting career in Pricing & Product Management! Do you love to solve problems? Do challenging analytical questions keep you up at night? Do you want to start a career with a focus on development and intellectual growth, with ample opportunity for upward mobility? We are looking for bright and driven future college graduates to join our Pricing Department at GEICO!Pricing is essential to GEICO’s continued success as one of the nation’s leading auto insurers. Analyst duties consist of determining rates for our various insurance products, analyzing and projecting drivers of loss trends, developing and enhancing new insurance products, and much more! Pricing Analysts are motivated, self-driven, and excellent analytical thinkers. As a Pricing Analyst, in addition to working with peers and management in Pricing, you can expect to work closely with our partners in Product Management on their assigned segments of the business. You will do more than crunch numbers – you will be active in determining business strategies, educating management on our profitability and projections, and communicating across departments to ensure company success. Your work as a Pricing Analyst will inform a wide range of critical business decisions.As a Pricing Analyst, you will:Develop and prepare statistical analyses of underwriting or claims experience, which serve as the basis of ratemaking or management information reportsDevelop and present analysis and proposals to various stakeholder groupsConduct rate reviews and create filings for a variety of segments of our businessCandidate Qualifications and Skills:Bachelor’s degree in Economics, Business, Math, Statistics, Data/Business Analytics, or other relevant quantitative field of study OR Bachelor’s degree in any field of study plus prior experience / internship with quantitative analytics; title: Intelligence Analyst SME (TS/SCI Required)
job_description: OPPORTUNITIES TO IGNITE YOUR PASSION, CRC services include Intelligence Analysis, Business Management, Cyber Operations, and Information Technology Consulting Services to the Department of Defense (DoD), Intelligence Community (IC) and other Federal Agencies. We offer a wide range of career opportunities and exceptional benefits.JOB SUMMARY: CRC seeks qualified Intelligence Analyst (Computer and Information Research Scientists) in Fort Meade, MD.DESCRIPTION: Qualified candidate will participate and provide input throughout all planning functions, from translating strategic guidance through concept and plan development to plan assessments and associated functions. Analyze the development, revision, and coordination of campaign, support, and contingency plans, including commander’s estimates, base plans, concept plans, and operations plans, and ensure Cyberspace operations are integrated with all appropriate and associated annexes and appendices. Coordinate and integrate DoD requirements, targets, and priorities into planning. Participate in all Joint operation contingency and crisis planning activities as a member of Joint Planning Groups (JPG) and Operational Planning Teams (OPTs), as needed to ensure proper representation of applicable guidance and doctrine into planning.ResponsibilitiesServes as SME, possessing in-depth knowledge on subjects relating to the conduct, activities, governance, business practices, or operation of USCYBERCOM.Provides extensive technical knowledge and analysis of exceptionally complex problems that need extensive knowledge of the subject matter for effective development and implementation of solutions.Provides technical solutions to a wide range of complex problems.Works independently without supervision.Possesses understanding and has wide experience in the application of technical principles, theories, and concepts in the required technical field, and has full knowledge of other related disciplines.Provides technical expertise in a particular area of IT (e.g., Information Systems Architecture, Telecommunications Systems Design, Architecture, Implementation, Information) SystemsMINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:10+ years of experience as an Intelligence AnalystActive TS/SCI clearance; willingness to take a polygraph examBachelor’s degreeCOMPANY DESCRIPTIONClear Resolution Consulting, LLC provides Intelligence Analysis, Business Management, Cyber Operations, and Information Technology Consulting Services to the Department of Defense (DoD), Intelligence Community (IC) and other Federal Agencies.This is a full-time position with employee and family medical, dental, and vision plans, life and AD&D insurance, generous holidays and personal leave, 401(K) with company matching, short-term/long-term disability insurance, and tuition assistance.Clear Resolution Consulting, LLC is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy and gender identity), national origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, genetic information, age, membership in an employee organization, retaliation, parental status, military service, any other non-merit factor, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Policy & Strategy Analyst with Security Clearance
job_description: Company OverviewFor over 25 years, Edgesource Corporation has served as an innovative technology service provider for the Department of Defense (DOD), Department of Homeland Security (DHS), Department of State (DOS), the U.S. Intelligence Community, Law Enforcement, and other federal, state, and commercial clients locally, nationally, and abroad. From providing boutique technical solutions in support of the DOD Counter Unmanned Aerial Systems (CUAS) mission set to addressing the most critical Cybersecurity threats facing our nation as a prime contractor with the DHS Cybersecurity & Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA), a career at Edgesource is an opportunity to do meaningful, interesting, and impactful work. Position Overview:Job DutiesEdgesource is seeking a Policy & Strategy Analyst within an exciting mission set in support of our government Sponsor. This position requires all duties to be performed full-time / onsite in the Bethesda, MD area. Job Duties:Apply systems engineering, technical analysis, along with operations and research principles, theories, and methods in the development of major issues studies and strategic evaluation reports of issues of National Intelligence Importance.Perform conduction planning, collection, and analysis of data, as well as with reviewing sizable amounts of data to develop methodologies and provide final results and recommendations on issues of National Intelligence importance.Gather study proposals from Intelligence Community (IC) stakeholders, evaluate for suitability, frame and revise for clarity, estimate study staffing and timeline requirements.Develop study design plan that includes objectives, key questions, stakeholder list, data gathering and analysis plan, and extensive issue framing.Collect study-relevant data and information using mixed methods of qualitative and quantitative sources which include literature reviews, survey design and administration, database queries and custom data calls of enterprise mission and budget data. Clean/normalize quantitative and qualitative data for later analysis as necessary.Analyze qualitative and quantitative data to answer study key questions and objectives favoring (but not limited to) an operations research approach to problems. Use a combination of descriptive statistics, case studies, sensitivity analysis, multi objective decision analysis and occasionally mathematical modeling to conduct the analysis.Create well supported alternatives from which decision makers can select courses of action.Write a long-form narrative analysis report for formal publishing and an executive-level summary presentation for consumption by senior IC executives and Congress.Conduct foundational studies, program evaluations, and create boiled-down issue summations for IC senior leaders. Required Qualifications:Possess an active TS/SCI with polygraph security clearanceQualitative and quantitative analysis skills including survey development and various forms of statistical analysisExperience with data collection and normalizationUse of statistical methods to perform cost effectiveness analysis, financial analysis, risk analysis, sensitivity analysis, etc.Senior executive-ready writing skills in both long form reports as well as summary presentation formatsSolid ability to author and/or work with complex spreadsheets and databasesIntelligence Community Experience (DoD experience may suffice)Previous experience conducting formal studies and ability to advise customer on how to conduct/improve their study process (e.g. evaluative techniques; development of Terms of ReferenceWorked at one of the major IC agencies of organizations or a DoD equivalent (e.g. CIA, NSA, NRO, DIA, ODNI, etc.)Ability to plan/build visualizations of quantitative and qualitative report elementsDesired Qualifications (NOT REQUIRED)Visual Basic or other scripting knowledgeExperience with Tableau, Microsoft Publisher and Project softwareExperience with JIRABusiness Process Reengineering/Mapping Skills Working At EdgesourceAs an ISO 9001:2015 certified and CMMI Level 3 appraised small business, Edgesource specializes in providing a variety of technical solutions to include software development, database services, enterprise networking, data center virtualization, and management support. We are always seeking top-talent to join our team in helping to address the most critical technical challenges facing our nation. At Edgesource, we understand that our employees are our greatest asset, and as such we offer a wide array of benefits to support the well-being of our staff to include: - Unlimited PTO + 11 Paid Holidays - Flexible Work Schedules (Remote / Hybrid) - Medical / Dental / Vision / Flexible Spending Account (FSA) - 401k Plan with Match - Tuition & Professional Development Support - Commuter Benefits - Bonus & Employee Referral Programs - Career Growth Opportunities Disclaimer:Edgesource Corporation is an affirmative action and equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, or genetic information. Edgesource is committed to providing access, equal opportunity and reasonable accommodation for individuals with disabilities in employment, its services, programs, and activities. To request reasonable accommodation, please contact our Recruiting Department by email at or by phone at (703) 837-0550.

title: TRAINING STRATEGY & PLANS ANALYST with Security Clearance

Education Some federal jobs allow you to substitute your education for the required experience in order to qualify. For this job, you must meet the qualification requirement using experience alone--no substitution of education for experience is permitted. Additional information * Male applicants born after December 31, 1959, must complete a Pre-Employment Certification Statement for Selective Service Registration. * You will be required to provide proof of U.S. Citizenship. * One year trial/probationary period may be required. * Direct deposit of pay is required. * Selection is subject to restrictions resulting from Department of Defense referral system for displaced employees. * If you have retired from federal service and you are interested in employment as a reemployed annuitant, see the information in the Reemployed Annuitant information sheet. * This is a 32 Education and Information Sciences Career Field position. * Multiple positions may be filled from this announcement. * Salary includes applicable locality pay or Local Market Supplement. * Payment of Permanent Change of Station (PCS) costs is not authorized, based on a determination that a PCS move is not in the Government interest. * Benefits Help A career with the U.S. government provides employees with a comprehensive benefits package. title: Budget Analyst
job_description: Requisition ID: 5818Location:Greenbelt, MD, US, 20770Pay Type: SalaryARE YOU READY TO BUILD PROGRESS WITH US? Driven by our purpose: Building progress for people and the planet. We are transforming to become the global leader in innovative and sustainable building solutions. Holcim is enabling greener cities, smarter infrastructure and improving living standards around the world. With sustainability at the core of its strategy Holcim is becoming a net zero company, with its people and communities at the heart of its success. The company is driving circular construction as a world leader in recycling to build more with less. Holcim is 70,000 people around the world who are passionate about building progress for people and the planet through four business segments: Cement, Ready-Mix Concrete, Aggregates and Solutions & Products.Description:JOB DESCRIPTION:Holcim (US) Inc. seeks a Budget Analyst at our office in Greenbelt, MD to support the Operation and Finance team and be a key member of the Asphalt team. The Budget Analyst’s job duties will include:Supporting the management of the department’s business and accounting systems, policies, and processes within Holcim procedures and financial policies.Ensuring that all financial transactions for the department are processed appropriately, under the supervision of the manager of finance and administration. Overseeing processes/issues contracts, purchase orders, vendor invoices; assigning appropriate cost codes; and ensuring work-flow processes flow smoothly. Monitoring the budget spending in whole and per area to ensure it is within budget limits and/or fiscal practices are followed. This includes allocations, expenditures, and related financial activities. Analyzing business information (e.g., labor and non-labor expenditures, utility expenses, inventory management, cost projections, etc.) to provide support, and recommendations to the operation team Preparing financial and budget tracking reports for each plant. Working within Facilities to re-engineer systems, processes, and procedures to improve financial reporting and streamline workflows. Supporting compliance with risk management, legal, financial requirements within established timeframes Demonstrating a commitment to communicating, improving, and adhering to safety policies in all work environments and areas. Note, this position does not require travel.REQUIREMENTS:The position of Budget Analyst requires a bachelor’s degree, or its foreign equivalent, in Accounting, Business Administration/Management, Supply Chain Management, or a closely-related field, plus 2 years of experience in the job offered, as a Management/Operations/Business Analyst, or in a related business analysis role. The position requires the following number of years of experience with each of the following: 2 years: Conducting financial analysis activities, including reading and creating financial statements (including Balance Sheets and P/L statements)  2 years: Conducting inventory management and supply chain management 2 years: SAP, Microsoft Office Applications, VLOOKUP, PivotTable, and VBA in Excel 1 year: Conducting purchase order management, overseeing product management processes, and overseeing implementation methods.  1 year: Conducting risk management and contract management 1 year: Working with plants/warehouses and retail/wholesale businesses 1 year: Applying supply-demand and production procedures.Your Holcim ExperienceAt Holcim, there is endless opportunity for you to play your part. Whether you’re in a technical, managerial, or frontline role, you can shape a career that works for you. With us you’ll have the chance to embrace the passion we share for our planet. You’ll be encouraged to seek out diverse perspectives, share your ideas and build the skills and connections you need to perform at your best. Because it’s only when we work together in a culture where everyone thrives, that we can build the world we all want to live in.Click To View Company Benefits OverviewIn compliance with the ADA Amendments Act (ADAAA), if you have a disability and would like to request accommodation in order to apply for a position with us, please call (773) 355-4557 or email recruiting-accommodations@holcim.com. This email address and phone number should only be used for accommodations and not general inquiries or resume submittals.Please visit our Pay Transparency Policy StatementDriven by our purpose to build sustainable solutions for people and our planet, Holcim US encourages interested candidates who meet many, even if not all of the job requirements to apply for a position. We provide a safe working environment for all and strive for diversity in our teams and inclusivity in our work.We take pride in our hiring processes and our commitment to all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, ethnicity, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, parental status, genetic information, citizenship, physical or mental disability, past, current, or prospective service in the uniformed services, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local law. Our goal is to drive diversity in our teams and inclusivity in our work. Holcim (US) Inc., Holcim - ACM Management, Inc., and their affiliates and subsidiaries are an Equal Opportunity Employer, deciding all employment on the basis of qualification, merit and business need.While we sincerely appreciate all applications, only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.Nearest Major Market: Washington DC

title: International Foreign Military Sales Financial Analyst, Senior with Security Clearance
job_description: Must be U.S. Citizen Clearance Required: Active Secret clearance Education: Master's Degree or allowable degree substitutions ALLOWABLE DEGREE SUBSTITUTION: Bachelor's Degree plus two (2) years additional work experience performing duties described in the functional description, OR Associate's Degree plus four (4) years additional work experience performing duties described in the functional description, OR Six (6) years additional work experience performing duties described in the functional description. Experience: More than ten years of experience are required for this position. Functional Description:Examine budget estimates for completeness, accuracy, and conformance with procedures and regulations. Analyze budgeting and accounting reports.Apply financial and budgeting knowledge and undertake objective and systematic analysis to draw accurate conclusions based on evidence.Provide budget support, including coordination of budget preparation, financial performance monitoring and reporting.Execute funds by processing funding documents, updating related requirements records, and supporting commercial activity.Evaluate and interrogate financial data to ensure the accuracy of financial information in reports and systems.
